choices.B: Add the class buffer as the first parameter.

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer.
You need to create an extension class.
Which action should you perform?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Actions you need to perform to create class extension are:
1. use [ExtensionOf(classStr(<class>))]
2. mark the class as "final"
3. extension class name has to end with "_Extension"
4. any extended method has to have "next"

choices.D: A model is a design time concept.
choices.A: A project can contain elements from multiple models.
choices.E: A package is a deployment unit that may contain one or more models.
choices.C: A Visual Studio project can belong to more than one model.
choices.B: A model is a group or collection of elements that constitute a distributable software solution.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
projects cannot be linked to multiple models

questions.question_text:
You are training a new Dynamics 365 Finance developer.
You need to explain the relationships between models, packages, and projects to the new hire.
Which three design concepts should you explain? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
questions.answer_description:
B: A model is a group of elements, such as metadata and source files, that typically constitute a distributable software solution and includes customizations of an existing solution.
D: A model is a design-time concept, for example a warehouse management model or a project accounting model.
E: A package is a deployment and compilation unit of one or more models.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/models

choices.C: Create a new privilege extension and add an output menu item. Add the privilege to a duty extension and then to a role extension.
choices.A: Create a new privilege, add a reference to an output menu item, and then add the new privilege to a role.
choices.D: Create a new privilege and assign it to an output menu item. Add the new privilege to a duty extension and then add the duty extension to a role.
choices.B: Create a new security policy and add an output menu item. Add the new security policy to duty extension and then to a role extension.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure security for the Vendor Exclusion List report.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
questions.answer_description:
Scenario: Develop necessary security permissions to view and maintain the new Vendor exclusion list functionality and reporting. Users with maintain rights will be able to create, update, and delete the exclusion list. Permissions must be assigned to security roles to match company security model.
The privileges are simply a way to grant permissions to an entry point, which can be services, to a duty, role, or even directly to a user. Typically, we only add entry points to a privilege, such as menu items.
D: You can extend a Security Role or a Security Duty to add new duties/privileges to these elements.
Incorrect Answers:
C: We can't extend security privileges, we would always create a new privilege.
Reference:
https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/extending-microsoft-dynamics/9781786467133/40a348f3-0f4c-4d47-a566-59f3a2e6afa0.xhtml https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/extensibility/customization-overlayering-extensions#security-role-and-duty-extensions

discussion.content:
The answers given are correct, A and D, disregard my other comment. Privilege extension is not possible:
https://community.dynamics.com/365/financeandoperations/f/dynamics-365-for-finance-and-operations-forum/361048/how-to-extend-d365-fin-op-privilege-security-feature-i-want-to-add-a-new-entry-point-of-display-menu

A is correct
B not correct
C not correct, you can't create extension of Privilege
D would be correct, but it is formulated wrong, should be "Create new Privilege and assign output menu item to its Entry points" rest is correct.
The answers given are correct, A and D
A & C looks more appropriate to me. The other options are invalid, specially, D, because a privilege is not assigned to an output menu item, but vice versa is true.

comments.content: NO, you can not "Create a new privilege extension", only Duplicate a privilege. So, A and D are correct!

discussion.content: The options seems weird to me, in option A and D it should be written as role extension not only role.

questions.answer_description:
Note: A sales manager suspects a data-related issue in the vendor exclusion list. User1 must identify the user who created the referenced exclusion records.
On each form in Microsoft Dynamics AX, there is a menu item Record info on the OPTIONS menu tab page.
Click on the Record info button to get the next dialog presented.
The dialog gives you also the option to show all fields or view database log records related to a certain record.

Reference:
https://kaya-consulting.com/en/how-to-rename-records-in-ax7/

choices.D: Navigate to the General tab, select Record Info, and then select Show all fields.
choices.A: Navigate to the General tab and select Database log
choices.C: Navigate to the Options tab and select Personalize this form. Add a field button and the required field.
choices.B: Navigate to the Page options tab, select Record Info, and then select Show all fields.

discussion.content: There is no General tab nor Page Options tab (it's a button group, not tab), so the only option left is... C? Add Created By field assumming it's turned on?

questions.question_text:
You need to investigate the Vendor exclusion list issue.
What should you do?

HOTSPOT -
You need to configure security for the CashDisc form.
What changes should you make? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Yes, should be C and A.

Since account payable manager already has access to the form we extend we don't have to do anything for him so only C is applicable I guess. Account payable clerk has delete access to the form, so even if we added another READ-ONLY privilege to the role, clerk will still have delete access. Only thing we can do here is create new role, duty, ready-only privilege and use that instead for Clerks.
Correct answer is C and A

I think it's B and A
Because AP Clerk need to restrict delete access. And the answer will only create new role.
So i assume that it use the existing duty and privilege.
Then i make the AP manager to create new duty and privilege then add them to the role.
